Key Match Events: Jaren Jackson Jr. had 20 points and seven rebounds, and the Memphis Grizzlies routed the Portland Trail Blazers 134-89 on Sunday night.
The Grizzlies jumped out to a 31-17 lead after the first quarter and led by as many as 25 in the first half.
In the opening quarter Edey boxed out Clingan and popped out the rebound to Scotty Pippen Jr., who made the 3-pointer to put the Grizzlies up 29-11 and the rout was on.
Pre-Game Insights: The Blazers held a moment of silence before the game for former broadcaster Brian Wheeler, who passed away on Friday at age 62.
Post-Match Reflections: Jerami Grant scored 20 points for Portland, which has lost three straight.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Memphis' 5-foot-8 Rookie Yuki Kawamura came into the game in the fourth quarter to applause from the Blazers fans.
The Grizzlies went into the game leading the league in points in the paint with 60.8. They had 58 against the Blazers.
Others: Memphis was missing Ja Morant, who is day-to-day with an injured right hip, and Marcus Smart and Desmond Bane.
The Blazers dug a deep hole in the first half, shooting just 17 of 49 from the floor. They were just 1 of 18 from 3-point range. The Blazers finished just 4 of 42 from 3-point range.
